tasks.title: Update Q1 roadmap
tasks.description: Update the Q1 roadmap to reflect onboarding as top priority and push the advanced analytics pilot to March.
tasks.evidence: Mira, please update the roadmap to reflect that, and push analytics pilot to March?

tasks.title: Define 3 onboarding success KPIs
tasks.description: Define 3 concrete Key Performance Indicators to measure onboarding success within 30 days.
tasks.evidence: Mira, I want 3 concrete KPIs to measure onboarding success within 30 days. Can you do that by tomorrow morning?

tasks.title: Plan lightweight usability test for new onboarding
tasks.description: Plan a quick, lightweight usability test (max two sessions) for the new onboarding prototype once it's ready.
tasks.deadline: After new onboarding prototype is ready
tasks.evidence: Leah: Should we plan a quick usability test after the new onboarding prototype is ready? Nothing big, like two sessions max? Jeffy: Sounds good. Keep it lightweight.

tasks.title: Ensure consistent messaging for silent onboarding launch
tasks.description: Ensure internal and external messaging is consistent with the decision for a silent onboarding update (no ads or blog posts).
tasks.evidence: Leah: I'll keep messaging consistent.

tasks.title: Deliver design assets to engineering
tasks.description: Deliver the necessary design assets to Arun for engineering work.
tasks.evidence: Leah: You'll have them by 8 PM.

tasks.title: Plan A/B test for deferred permissions
tasks.description: Plan and implement an A/B test to evaluate deferring some permissions on the second onboarding step post-launch.
tasks.evidence: Yes, put that in as an A/B test post-launch.

tasks.title: Design and add explanatory microcopy/tooltips
tasks.description: Design and add short explanatory tooltips for the permission screen to reduce user confusion.
tasks.evidence: Jeffy: Sounds good, Daniel. Can you work on that? Daniel: Will do.

tasks.title: Record usability test sessions
tasks.description: Ensure all usability test sessions are recorded for detailed analysis.
tasks.evidence: Jeffy: Excellent. Make sure to record sessions for analysis.

tasks.title: Draft internal messaging regarding analytics pilot delay
tasks.description: Draft messaging to internal teams (e.g., marketing) to manage expectations about the analytics pilot being pushed to March.
tasks.evidence: Leah, please help draft messaging to internal teams.

tasks.title: Fix data pipeline bugs for analytics
tasks.description: Use the extra time from the analytics pilot delay to identify and fix data pipeline bugs to improve data accuracy.
tasks.evidence: Jeffy: Absolutely. Use the extra time to fix data pipeline bugs.

tasks.title: Prepare roadmap update deck
tasks.description: Prepare a concise deck outlining the key changes and dates in the updated Q1 roadmap.
tasks.evidence: Jeffy: Deck with key changes and dates. Keep it tight.

tasks.title: Prepare for Q&A at Thursday onboarding demo
tasks.description: Prepare to field questions from the team during the internal onboarding demo on Thursday.
tasks.evidence: Jeffy: Yes, Mira, you should be prepped.

tasks.title: Prepare user feedback snippets for onboarding demo
tasks.description: Prepare quick user feedback snippets to present during the internal onboarding demo.
tasks.evidence: Leah: I can prepare quick user feedback snippets for the demo.

tasks.title: Invite customer success to onboarding demo
tasks.description: Invite the customer success team to the internal onboarding demo on Thursday.
tasks.evidence: Leah: Should we invite customer success team? Jeffy: Yeah, good idea.

tasks.title: Conduct smoke tests for onboarding
tasks.description: QA team to conduct smoke tests for the onboarding flow.
tasks.evidence: Arun: QA is prepping test cases for onboarding. Will do smoke tests by Wednesday.

tasks.title: Finish final design icons
tasks.description: Finish the remaining final design icons for onboarding, which are currently a blocker.
tasks.evidence: Daniel: Yep, finishing final icons today.

tasks.title: Review final design icons
tasks.description: Review the final design icons completed by Daniel.
tasks.evidence: Leah: I'll review those tomorrow morning.

tasks.title: Add qualitative feedback to post-onboarding survey
tasks.description: Add a qualitative feedback question, such as an 'ease of use' rating, to the post-onboarding survey.
tasks.evidence: Leah: We'll add that to post-onboarding survey.

tasks.title: Expedite hiring of design intern
tasks.description: Expedite the process for hiring a design intern to address the current design resource crunch, as HR has candidates lined up.
tasks.evidence: Jeffy: Cool, please speed that up.

tasks.title: Build onboarding as modular pieces
tasks.description: Ensure the onboarding flow is built using modular components to facilitate future iterations and avoid rewrites.
tasks.evidence: Jeffy: Worth it. Build modular to avoid rewrites later.

tasks.title: Design clearer error messages
tasks.description: Design clearer and more helpful error messages for the onboarding flow based on user feedback.
tasks.evidence: Daniel: Will work on error message designs next week.

tasks.title: Send weekly onboarding progress updates to Marketing
tasks.description: Send weekly email updates to the marketing team regarding the onboarding progress.
tasks.evidence: Jeffy: Weekly email updates to them.

tasks.title: Coordinate legal compliance check for analytics data retention
tasks.description: Coordinate with the legal team for a compliance check on the analytics data retention policy.
tasks.evidence: Mira: I’ll coordinate.

tasks.title: Update onboarding help pages
tasks.description: Update the relevant help pages for the new onboarding experience.
tasks.evidence: Leah: Yes, updating onboarding help pages this week.

analysis_results.meeting_summary: The meeting established the onboarding revamp as the top priority for Q1, pushing the advanced analytics pilot to March. Key outcomes included defining onboarding KPIs, planning usability tests, and preparing for a Thursday internal demo, with a focus on modular development and a silent launch.
decisions: Onboarding revamp is the top priority for Q1.
The advanced analytics pilot will be pushed to March.
The onboarding launch will be a silent update, with no marketing ads or blog posts.
Core onboarding steps are prioritized over extra features.
A lightweight usability test for the new onboarding prototype will be conducted.
An internal onboarding demo will be held on Thursday, showing the core flow with integrated backend and mostly done UI.
The onboarding flow should be built using modular pieces to avoid future rewrites.
Multi-language support for onboarding is not planned for the initial Q1 launch.

tasks.title: Integrate dynamic obstacle model for robot navigation
tasks.description: Raj needs to work on integrating a dynamic obstacle model or a more adaptive approach to improve robot navigation, specifically addressing struggles with dynamic obstacles in real-world environments.
tasks.evidence: Nina: Okay, sounds like a plan. Can you prioritize that for this sprint? Raj: Yeah, I can work on integrating that this week, although I’m a bit swamped with other tasks, but I’ll try to make it happen.

tasks.title: Collaborate on a better LIDAR filtering approach
tasks.description: Raj will collaborate with Maya to find a better filtering approach for the new LIDAR sensor, which is showing sporadic spikes and noise issues, to improve obstacle detection.
tasks.evidence: Nina: Raj, could you help Maya with that? Maybe collaborate on a better filtering approach? Raj: Yeah, that makes sense. I’ll set aside some time to look into it. Probably Thursday or Friday.

tasks.title: Prioritize testing and tuning drift correction algorithm
tasks.description: Liam needs to prioritize testing and tuning the new drift correction algorithm he is developing, aiming to have a prototype ready soon.
tasks.evidence: Nina: Okay, Liam, prioritize testing and tuning that. Can you have a prototype by next week? Liam: I’ll do my best.

tasks.title: Draft methodology and experiments sections for the paper
tasks.description: Raj and Maya will be responsible for drafting the methodology and experiments sections of the upcoming conference paper.
tasks.deadline: TBD (by November 20th implicitly for final draft)
tasks.evidence: Nina: Raj, you and Maya can draft methodology and experiments sections? Raj: Yeah, sounds good. Maya: Sure, happy to.

tasks.title: Draft results and discussion sections for the paper
tasks.description: Liam will be responsible for drafting the results and discussion sections of the upcoming conference paper.
tasks.deadline: TBD (by November 20th implicitly for final draft)
tasks.evidence: Nina: Liam, can you work on results and discussion? Liam: Will do.

tasks.title: Draft intro and abstract sections for the paper
tasks.description: Nina will be responsible for drafting the introduction and abstract sections of the upcoming conference paper.
tasks.deadline: TBD (by November 20th implicitly for final draft)
tasks.evidence: Nina: And I’ll handle intro and abstract.

tasks.title: Attend paper writing session
tasks.description: All participants are expected to attend a scheduled writing session to work on the conference paper.
tasks.evidence: Maya: Should we schedule a writing session next week? Nina: Good idea. How about Tuesday at 3 PM? Raj: Works for me. Liam: Same here. Maya: Okay, Tuesday it is.

tasks.title: Check with admin for new LIDAR sensor order
tasks.description: Nina will check with administration to fast-track an order for an additional LIDAR sensor due to current heavy use and repair needs.
tasks.evidence: Raj: We might need an extra LIDAR sensor. ... Nina: Let me check with admin. Hopefully, they can fast-track a new order.

tasks.title: Help test patches for simulation environment update
tasks.description: Liam will help test patches when they become available to fix bugs in the updated simulation environment, particularly issues with the physics engine not syncing correctly.
tasks.evidence: Maya: Also, the simulation environment crashed twice last week. We need to update it. Liam: I can help test patches when they come out. Nina: Thanks, Liam. That’ll be a big help.

tasks.title: Plan and conduct a power audit for the robot
tasks.description: The team needs to plan and conduct an audit of the robot's power consumption, as battery life is low and some modules draw more current than expected.
tasks.evidence: Raj: Also, the robot’s battery life is low. Should we look into replacements or optimize power consumption? Liam: Yeah, I think a power audit is due. Nina: Let’s plan for that next week.

tasks.title: Monitor risks related to project progress
tasks.description: Raj and Maya should continue to monitor the identified risks: underestimating time needed for dynamic obstacle integration (Raj) and potential delays in hardware delivery (Maya).
tasks.evidence: Raj: The main risk is underestimating the time needed for dynamic obstacle integration. Maya: Also, potential delays in hardware delivery could hold us back. Nina: Okay, keep monitoring those.

tasks.title: Audit the data logging system
tasks.description: Raj will conduct an audit of the data logging system to investigate inconsistencies and lost data packets during wireless transmission. Liam will assist with this audit.
tasks.evidence: Raj: One more thing — I noticed our data logging system is inconsistent. ... Nina: Let’s have an audit of the logging system by Friday. Raj: Will do. Nina: ...Liam to test drift correction and assist with logging audit...

tasks.title: Address LIDAR sensor noise issues
tasks.description: Maya needs to continue addressing the sporadic spikes and noise issues with the new LIDAR sensor, potentially exploring more advanced filtering algorithms. Raj will collaborate on this.
tasks.evidence: Maya: Oh, speaking of sensors, the new LIDAR we got last month? It’s showing some noise issues. ... Maya: Yeah, I started with a basic median filter, but it might need something more advanced... Nina: Raj, could you help Maya with that? ... Nina: Maya to handle sensor noise...

tasks.title: Conduct further experiments to improve robot success rate
tasks.description: Maya will continue running experiments in the cluttered environment scenario with the goal of increasing the robot's success rate to at least 80% to be competitive for the conference.
tasks.evidence: Maya: Speaking of experiments, I ran the latest robot in the cluttered environment scenario last week. The success rate was about 65%... Liam: But we still need to get to at least 80% to be competitive for the conference. Nina: Maya to... run experiments

analysis_results.meeting_summary: The team reviewed progress on robot navigation, sensor issues, and paper writing for an upcoming conference. Key decisions included prioritizing robot stability for a December demo, finalizing paper experiments by November 20th, and scheduling a collaborative writing session. Several tasks were assigned to address technical challenges, resource needs, and system audits.
decisions: Experiments and results for the conference paper need to be finalized by November 20th.
A paper writing session is scheduled for next Tuesday at 3 PM.
Demo stability for the robot is the top priority for development leading up to the December robotics conference.
A power audit for the robot will be planned for next week.

tasks.title: Stabilize sensor array
tasks.description: Mark needs to ensure the new sensor array, currently 80% assembled, is stabilized to address calibration issues with temperature sensors.
tasks.evidence: Elena: Okay, can you have it stabilized by end of the week? Mark: I’m pushing for it, but might need extra help.

tasks.title: Assist with sensor array stabilization
tasks.description: Jin will spare time on Thursday to assist Mark with the sensor array stabilization efforts.
tasks.evidence: Jin: I can spare some time Thursday to assist.

tasks.title: Implement power smoothing circuit
tasks.description: Sofia will implement a power smoothing circuit to mitigate intermittent resets on the main control board, which are suspected to be caused by power spikes.
tasks.evidence: Sofia: Implementing a power smoothing circuit, hoping that helps.

tasks.title: Coordinate to verify power supply stability
tasks.description: Mark will coordinate with Jin to verify the stability of the power supply, likely related to the power spike issue causing firmware resets.
tasks.evidence: Mark: I’ll coordinate with Jin to verify power supply stability.

tasks.title: Analyze battery runtime discrepancy
tasks.description: Mark needs to analyze why the actual battery runtime is 15% less than specification.
tasks.evidence: Elena: Prioritize analyzing that this week. Mark: Will do.

tasks.title: Work on environmental noise mitigation in firmware
tasks.description: Jin will work on mitigating environmental noise within the firmware, in preparation for the field test next month.
tasks.evidence: Jin: I’ll work on environmental noise mitigation in the firmware.

tasks.title: Design adjustable mechanical mounts
tasks.description: Sofia's team is designing adjustable mounts to compensate for alignment issues encountered during assembly, which could cause sensor misreads.
tasks.evidence: Sofia: We’re designing adjustable mounts to compensate.

tasks.title: Improve sensor fusion algorithms
tasks.description: Mark is collaborating with Jin to improve sensor fusion algorithms, specifically focusing on handling noisy inputs.
tasks.evidence: Mark: On software, I’m collaborating with Jin on improving sensor fusion algorithms to handle noisy inputs.

tasks.title: Tweak Kalman filter for sensor fusion
tasks.description: Jin is working on a specific tweak to the Kalman filter as part of the effort to improve sensor fusion algorithms.
tasks.evidence: Jin: Yeah, working on a Kalman filter tweak.

tasks.title: Update integration guide documentation
tasks.description: Sofia's team is responsible for updating the integration guide documentation.
tasks.evidence: Sofia: For documentation, we’re updating the integration guide this week.

tasks.title: Chase vendor for custom cable delivery
tasks.description: Mark needs to continue chasing the vendor regarding the delay in custom cable delivery, which has moved from Monday to Thursday.
tasks.evidence: Mark: One blocker is the delay in custom cables — vendor moved delivery from Monday to Thursday. Elena: Keep chasing.

tasks.title: Provide support for power analysis if needed
tasks.description: Mark has offered to pitch in and support Jin with power analysis if Jin requires assistance.
tasks.evidence: Elena: Alright, if needed, Mark can support.

tasks.title: Prep demo slides and data
tasks.description: The team needs to prepare slides and data for the upcoming demo, focusing on reliable sensors, battery endurance, stable firmware, and the new mounting design.
tasks.evidence: Elena: Let’s prep slides and data for that.

tasks.title: Debug intermittent firmware crashes
tasks.description: Mark's team needs to debug the intermittent firmware crashes that have been reported during testing.
tasks.evidence: Mark: On testing, some intermittent firmware crashes were reported. We need to debug.

tasks.title: Set up detailed logs for firmware debugging
tasks.description: Jin will set up detailed logs to aid in debugging the intermittent firmware crashes.
tasks.evidence: Jin: I’ll set up detailed logs for that.

tasks.title: Track integration issues
tasks.description: Sofia will track integration issues on an ongoing basis.
tasks.evidence: Sofia: I’ll track integration issues and help with testing.

tasks.title: Help with lab and outdoor testing
tasks.description: Sofia will assist with the planned lab tests (next two weeks) and outdoor trials (following week) for all components.
tasks.deadline: Next two weeks (lab tests), then following week (outdoor trials)
tasks.evidence: Sofia: I’ll track integration issues and help with testing.

analysis_results.meeting_summary: The team discussed the hardware prototype's progress, focusing on stabilizing the sensor array, investigating firmware resets and battery runtime discrepancies, and preparing for an upcoming field test. Key actions include addressing power issues, refining sensor fusion algorithms, and updating documentation, while managing custom cable delays as a critical risk.
decisions: Jin will assist Mark with sensor array stabilization starting Thursday.
A power smoothing circuit will be implemented by Sofia to mitigate intermittent firmware resets.
Analysis of the battery runtime discrepancy is prioritized for this week, owned by Mark.
Jin will work on environmental noise mitigation in the firmware.
Sofia's team will design adjustable mechanical mounts to address assembly alignment issues.
The integration guide documentation will be updated this week by Sofia's team.
Elena directed Mark to keep chasing the vendor for custom cable delivery.
Mark will provide support to Jin for power analysis if needed.
The team will prep slides and data for the demo, focusing on reliable sensors, battery endurance, stable firmware, and new mounting design.
Jin will set up detailed logs to assist with debugging intermittent firmware crashes.

planned_tasks.description: Sofia will assist with the planned lab tests (next two weeks) and outdoor trials (following week) for all components.

planned_tasks.evidence: Sofia: I’ll track integration issues and help with testing.

tasks.title: Update report with robot improvement metrics
tasks.description: Update the notes and stats in the report to carefully document the noticeable improvement in the robot's path planning and fewer collisions overall.
tasks.evidence: Sam: That’s encouraging. Let’s be sure to document that carefully, especially the improvement metrics. Priya, can you ensure those go into the report? Priya: Absolutely, I’ll update the notes and stats this afternoon.

tasks.title: Apply filters to clean noisy battery data
tasks.description: Apply filters to clean the noisy battery log data to make it easier to pinpoint the cause of unexpected robot shutdowns (hardware or firmware).

tasks.title: Collaborate on battery issue investigation
tasks.description: Sync up and collaborate with Priya to dig deeper into the unexpected robot battery shutdowns after applying filters to clean the data, and keep Sam posted on progress.

tasks.description: Update the data analysis section of the experiment wiki pages.
tasks.evidence: Derek: I’ll handle updating the data analysis section.

tasks.title: Circulate paper draft for internal review
tasks.description: Circulate the first draft of the paper, including methods and results sections, for internal review.
tasks.evidence: Nina: The first draft of methods and results is mostly done. We’re aiming to circulate it by Friday for internal review.

tasks.title: Send calendar invites for paper review session
tasks.description: Send calendar invites for the paper review session scheduled for Monday afternoon.
tasks.evidence: Nina: Yeah, Monday afternoon. I’ll send calendar invites.

tasks.title: Add section on experimental limitations to paper
tasks.description: Add a section to the paper detailing experimental limitations, including transparency on sensor and battery issues, to be upfront with reviewers and readers.
tasks.evidence: Priya: Should we add a section about experimental limitations in the paper? Like transparency on sensor and battery issues. Sam: Definitely. It’s important to be upfront about that.

analysis_results.meeting_summary: The team addressed persistent timing sensor and robot battery issues, deciding to implement manual logging as a temporary solution and to thoroughly investigate battery data. They agreed to focus the upcoming conference demo on obstacle avoidance, utilizing a mix of recorded and simple live demonstrations. Additionally, the first draft of the research paper is due Friday for internal review, and it was decided to include a section on experimental limitations.
decisions: Manual logging will be used as a backup to maintain data continuity due to timing sensor issues.
The conference demo in December will focus on obstacle avoidance and path optimization, which have stable data.
The conference demo will consist of a recorded demo of the full run, supplemented with live Q&A, and a short, simple live robot demonstration.
A section about experimental limitations, covering sensor and battery issues, will be added to the research paper.

tasks.title: Complete final version of explainer video

tasks.evidence: Tara: About a week. We should have the final version by next Friday.

tasks.title: Communicate launch and marketing shifts to leadership team
tasks.description: Clearly communicate the updated product launch timeline and corresponding shifts in the marketing plan to the leadership team.
tasks.evidence: Sophia: Yeah, we’ll have to shift accordingly. We need to communicate this clearly to the leadership team.

tasks.title: Continue working on influencer/partner pitches
tasks.description: Proceed with developing and refining pitches for influencers and potential partners to secure early interest and commitments.
tasks.evidence: Aisha: A few big names have shown early interest, but nothing locked in yet. Still working on pitches.

tasks.title: Distribute customer support FAQ document
tasks.description: Share the completed Quick Reference FAQ document with the customer support team to aid in their training for the new platform.
tasks.evidence: Tara: Speaking of FAQs, the doc is almost done — will distribute next week.

tasks.title: Start publishing social media teaser posts
tasks.description: Initiate the social media content calendar for December by publishing teaser posts to generate buzz for the upcoming launch.
tasks.evidence: Tara: Content calendar is set for December, with teaser posts starting next week.

tasks.title: Develop fallback plans for analytics platform bugs/lags
tasks.description: Create contingency plans, such as manual monitoring and periodic audits, in case the new analytics platform experiences bugs or lags at launch.
tasks.evidence: Sophia: Let’s have fallback plans — maybe manual monitoring and periodic audits.

tasks.title: Monitor ad spend carefully
tasks.description: Keep a close watch on advertising expenditures, especially for digital ads, to stay within budget limits given potential fluctuations.
tasks.evidence: Tara: Budget-wise, we’re still within limits, but need to monitor ad spend carefully, especially with digital ads fluctuating.

tasks.title: Adjust marketing messaging to emphasize unique advantages
tasks.description: Revise the current marketing messaging and positioning to highlight unique product advantages in response to a competitor's recent announcement of a similar feature.
tasks.evidence: Sophia: Thanks for the heads-up. Tara, please start adjusting messaging to emphasize our unique advantages.

tasks.title: Encourage breaks and monitor team workload to prevent burnout
tasks.description: Implement measures to encourage team members to take breaks and closely monitor individual workloads to address and prevent team burnout.
tasks.evidence: Sophia: Important point. We need to encourage breaks and monitor workload carefully. Burnout will hurt post-launch support.

analysis_results.meeting_summary: The team discussed product launch delays due to QA issues and an explainer video holdup, pushing the timeline to mid-December or early January. Key decisions were made regarding updating stakeholders, adjusting marketing strategies due to a competitor, preparing analytics fallback plans, and proactively managing team burnout.
decisions: The product launch timeline is now flexible, potentially shifting to mid-December or early January, due to ongoing QA delays in payment integration and a delayed explainer video.
Marketing messaging will be adjusted to emphasize unique product advantages in response to a competitor's recent announcement of a similar feature.
Fallback plans (manual monitoring, periodic audits) will be developed for the analytics platform to mitigate risks of bugs or lags at launch.
Team workload and breaks will be carefully monitored to prevent burnout, acknowledging its potential impact on post-launch support.
